Northview High School art teacher Tricia Erickson, back, and GVSU Lakers student teacher Tuyetnhi Pham are readying Erickson's classroom for the start of school on Aug. 25. Erickson is concerned for the health of students and staff and said "the best-laid lesson plans will probably go out the window." But she believes it is necessary to try to open with some in-person learning, adding: "I feel good about it." School News Network will publish a roundup on Aug. 26 with thoughts from students, teachers, parents and others around the Kent ISD about what could be a uniquely challenging school year.
#realschoolnews

The regional Odyssey of the Mind tournament took place in February. Northview had three teams competing. Our primary team from East & North Oakview put on a great performance, earning nearly all 4 stars. They also won an award for stage presence. The Division 1 team included kids from Highlands, West & North Oakview. This team placed 1st in the region & advanced to move on to the state tournament for a chance to compete at World Finals. Unfortunately, the state tournament was canceled due to COVID-19. And while they were eligible to compete in the virtual World Finals, videos were due during the shelter in place in Michigan so they were not able to meet to run their performance. Our Division 2 team from Highlands didn't place, but should be congratulated for participating and coming up with a solution!

New teams will be formed in Fall. You can 'like' the NorthviewOM Facebook page for updates.
